full_threads.body: Thank you, Dirk
closing this one as their IT person resolved the MX records

Heilsan Folks,

I have updated DNS records to create a specific pathway for the e-mail to continue to function with the existing system.

I will monitor it and ensure that it's operational.

DNS records have been set as follows specifically for email:

mail.p76clubnsw.org was a CNAME which pointed to p76clubnsw.org which was changed to point to the new hosting address. I have removed it and replaced it with an A record that points to the existing hosting service 103.152.248.148 specifically for the email.

I have created an mx.p76clubnsw.org record pointing to the IP 103.152.248.148 which resolves the mx record for p76clubnsw.org which now points to it.

Cheers

Dirk

Hi Paul,

No problem - glad I could help you

Let me know if there's anything else I can help you

Thanks for your email ,
Unfortunately, it's been so long since the email was set up we can't remember the password. I will try and contact Dirk tomorrow!

Regards
Paul

Hi Paul,

Thanks so much for your message!

I understand how important it is to get everything working smoothly before the club meeting - especially when emails are the main way to reach everyone.

Here’s what I can see:
  • I don’t have direct access to your DNS settings, which handle how your emails and website are connected behind the scenes.
  • Your domain is pointed through Dirk, so he may be the best person to double-check the MX records (these control where your emails are delivered). Since he manages the DNS side, he’ll be able to see if everything looks right there.
  • It could also be something within the email service itself, so we’ll want to check both just to be sure.

I’m more than happy to take a look from my end as well - you can log in at the link below. If you could share the username and password, I’ll review the email service settings and make sure everything is set up properly:
🔗 https://pdr4227.partnerconsole.net/

Once both sides are checked, I’m confident we’ll have everything back on track so your treasurer can send out the meeting updates without any issues.

Please let me know if there’s anything else I can help with - always happy to lend a hand. 😊

Hi Allie,

I received a call from our club treasurer and he has informed me that he can not send emails to club members at the moment . We have our club meeting on Tuesday night and need to communicate to other members regarding the meeting.
Would you know what the issue is.

Thank you in advance
Paul Abela

Hi Dirk,

Thank you so much for the help! I really appreciate it confirming it's now pointed in our servers

Thank you so much guys I really apperciate you

Hi Dirk,

Thanks so much for jumping on this - really appreciate you confirming the A record is now pointing to our servers.

Everything looks good on our end so far! We’ll keep an eye on it, but this should have things running smoothly for everyone now.

Thanks again to you and the team - really appreciate the support!

Heilsan Folks,

P76clubnsw.org A record has been updated to 162.159.134.42

www.p76clubnsw.org points to P76clubnsw.org

Hopefully, this should get things working for everyone.

Cheers

Dirk

Hi Dirk,

Thanks so much for jumping on those updates - really appreciate it!

Just a quick heads-up: it looks like the A Record for www still isn’t showing up on our end. Would you mind adding this one when you get a chance?
A Record
  • Name/Host: www
  • IP Address: 162.159.134.42

Also, if it’s easier, we’d be happy to make the changes directly. Could you please share access credentials or let us know if there’s a portal we can log into?

Let me know what works best - always happy to help however we can!

Hi there Allie,

I've updated a few of the records as advised. I will take a look at them later to adjust as per the below.

Cheers

Dirk

Hi Dirk,

Happy Friday!

Here are the DNS records you'll need to point the domain to Kinsta:

A Record
  • Name/Host: www
  • IP Address: 162.159.134.42

If you already have an A, AAAA, or CNAME record with the same Name/Host, please remove it and replace it with the one above.
Note: Some DNS management services require you to add the root domain to your host names. If that’s the case, please use www.p76clubnsw.org  instead of just www  for the Name/Host.

After updating, it can take up to 24 hours for the changes to take effect.

I might be sending through a few more DNS records depending on the hosting platform, so I’ll keep you posted if anything else needs updating.

Let me know once this is done or if you run into any issues.

Hi Dirk,

Thank you so much!

Here are the DNS records you’ll need to add:

A Record
  • Name/Host: www
  • IP Address: 103.152.248.148

TXT Record
  • Name/Host: _cf-custom-hostname.www
  • Value: 23c9483d-7755-4ddd-9b37-8febb97ff9c0

CNAME Record
  • Name/Host: _acme-challenge.www
  • Domain Name (Value): www.p76clubnsw.org.kinstavalidation.app

Some DNS management services require you to use the full domain name for the host fields.
If that’s the case, please use:
  • _cf-custom-hostname.www.p76clubnsw.org  instead of _cf-custom-hostname.www
  • _acme-challenge.www.p76clubnsw.org  instead of _acme-challenge.www
Once these have been added, I'll let you know if there's more dns records to add

Thank you so much Dirk, I really appreciate it.

Hi there,

Yes, most certainly, send through the required DNS Settings and I will point the current hosting to the required location.

Cheers

Dirk

Hi Dirk,

Thanks so much for sending that through! I gave the EPP password a try (H;btwoM9!Q ), but unfortunately, I wasn’t able to access the domain transfer settings on our end.

Would it be easier if we just sent you the DNS records directly instead? That might be the quickest way to get everything pointed where it needs to go.


Let me know what works best for you, happy to help either way!

Heilsan Folks,

Finally, great success 😊

Here is the necessary:

EPP password

H;btwoM9!Q

Cheers

Dirk

Hi Dirk and team,

Happy Tuesday, hope your week’s going well so far!

Just a quick follow-up on the DNS access. We’re still on standby on our end and ready to move forward as soon as access comes through, no rush at all, just wanted to check in.

Thanks again for all your help, really appreciate it!

Hi Dirk and team,

Happy Monday! Hope you all had a good weekend.

Just gently circling back on the DNS access, we’re still waiting on our side to move forward with the account access. No pressure at all.

Thanks as always for your help, and hope the week’s off to a smooth start!

Hi team,

Thanks for the update! We’ll wait for the DNS record on your end, just let us know once it’s ready.

Really appreciate your help on this, Dirk, David (and Paul too!), thank you so much for assisting.

Let me know if there’s anything else you need from our side.

Heilsan Folks,

I did get an e-mail from David of the P76 Car Club at 8:12 pm last night but missed it. I will keep an eye out for an e-mail from him and we can then do the reset.

Cheers

Dirk

Hi Dirk

David from the P76 Car Club here .

I will watch out for the reset request tonight . Going off to watch some TV now , I will check back in say 45minutes .

Kind Regards

David Place

President
Leyland P76 Owners Club Of NSW

Mobile: 0417 190 245

Hi Allie,

Yep, can do. We will probably need who is checking the admin e-mail for the P76 Club to be ready as the reset request will go there.

Cheers

Dirk
